name: Stack
description: The AWS::CloudFormation::Stack type nests a stack as a resource in a top-level template.

properties.name: NotificationARNs
properties.description: A list of existing Amazon SNS topics where notifications about stack events are sent.

properties.name: Parameters
properties.description: The set of parameters passed to AWS CloudFormation when this nested stack is created.
properties.update: Whether an update causes interruptions depends on the resources that are being update. An update never causes a nested stack to be replaced.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) to describe this stack.

properties.name: TemplateURL
properties.description: The URL of a template that specifies the stack that you want to create as a resource. The template must be stored on an Amazon S3 bucket, so the URL must have the form: https://s3.amazonaws.com/.../TemplateName.template
properties.update: Whether an update causes interruptions depends on the resources that are being update. An update never causes a nested stack to be replaced.

properties.name: TimeoutInMinutes
properties.description: The length of time, in minutes, that AWS CloudFormation waits for the nested stack to reach the CREATE_COMPLETE state. The default is no timeout. When AWS CloudFormation detects that the nested stack has reached the CREATE_COMPLETE state, it marks the nested stack resource as CREATE_COMPLETE in the parent stack and resumes creating the parent stack. If the timeout period expires before the nested stack reaches CREATE_COMPLETE, AWS CloudFormation marks the nested stack as failed and rolls back both the nested stack and parent stack.

attributes.name: Outputs.NestedStackOutputName
attributes.description: Returns: The output value from the specified nested stack where NestedStackOutputName is the name of the output value.
